dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly, what's going on? Kimberly moves toward Shaina's window. As she leans her h Shaina's window, an ominous BREEZE blows back their hair the BLARING HORN of a TRUCK. And Kimberly is unexpectedly yanked backward by Thomas! From nowhere, a SHRIEK of BRAKES as a JACK-KNIFED TRUCK p across the frame! CRASH! Flying debris misses Kimberly an inches! Kimberly cries in horror into Thomas' shoulder as her fri in the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAOS. Evan, the driver of the Trans Am, impatiently spea DETECTIVE SUBY, late 40s, professional with an open face him a great listener. EVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you want from me. Some crazy chic k blocks the highway with her car, said there'd be an accident and there was. Big deal. Even a broken watch is right twice a day... Officer Thomas Burke passes by, heading into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat, Eugene, Nora, Tim, and Rory sit in a large room, wai statements. Unlike Evan, these witnesses are clearly dist KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to sound insensitive, but how much longer is this going to take? EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't get back to my classroom soon, the kids'll tear the room apart. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those poor people. To think it would've been us if not for... PAN OVER TO REVEAL KIMBERLY. She's still in shock, her mi Thomas sits close to her, speaking softly. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me again how it started. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, it was like I was there. I remember everything. The sounds of the crashes, the smells, the look on Shaina's face... THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember what triggered it all? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The log truck...and everybody I guess. Everyone was driving like a maniac. And somehow I knew something horrible was going to happen, even before it did. Something clicks for Thomas, but he forces himself to spe like a lawyer leading a friendly witness. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew? You just mean a hunch, right? A bad vibe, maybe? The other drivers stare at Kimberly. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than that. All the songs on the radio were about car crashes. Some kid's banging toy cars together. (lookin g at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was dialing her cell phone with her headset on. (points to Rory)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His car was leaking oil all over the road. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't be knockin' the Chevette. But the others listen intently now. Especially Kat, who s headset buried deep in her purse. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billboards about accidents. Kids yelling "pile up" for no reason. It all felt...just wrong. Just like... (swallows; hesitates) THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? Kimberly sighs and looks down. The room becomes eerily si for the FLICKER of a florescent light. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this sounds crazy...but you all heard about Flight 180, right? The kid who got off the plane? Thomas' eyes widen -- then a startling CRASH as Rory, le his chair, tips over. Thomas rolls his eyes as Rory grins and picks himself up. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Alex Browning. KIMBERLY (looking down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My Premonition was just like his. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? EUGENE (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you must have read about that kid who had a dream about a plane crash so he got his buddies off the plane? Then the thing blew up just like in the dream? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... Eugene sees Nora and Tim are hooked and speaks in scary c tones. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is where it starts to get freaky. So a month goes by, everything seems cool, but then the survivors start dying one boy one. 'Cause when your number's up, it's up, right? Some people said Death itself started coming for them, hunting down every last one, until they were all dead. Everyone tenses up. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not quite all of them. Clear Rivers checked herself into a padded room at Stoneybrook. Kimberly, affected, looks to Thomas for confirmation. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do believe me, don't you? BANG! Everyone jumps as Detective Suby pounds on the door it. DETECTIVE SUBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Burke? Could I see you in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR OPENS. Detective Suby enters, leading Thomas. Th way mirror, they can see the others chatting anxiously. DETECTIVE SUBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you didn't start up on that Flight 180 shit again. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you? THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. That would be irresponsible and unprofessional. Detective Suby's persistent glare makes Thomas uncomforta THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you weren't there. It was weird. She knew that log truck was gonna cause an accident, she knew. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. DETECTIVE SUBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we we re finished with this bullshit. This is police work, not the psychic Hot Line. But Thomas isn't listening. He's glued to Kimberly's word Detective Suby realizes this, he stops and listens. KIMBER LY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if I was never meant to pull over, then we all should have died in the pile up. TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means Death could be coming for us. Detective Suby looks pissed o ff. DETECTIVE SUBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to console the witnesses Burke. At the same time, we watch Evan enter the other room, gra and wave goodbye to the others. DETECTIVE SUBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got 'em thinking Death is after them? Shit, they're the luckiest sons o' bitches on the planet. Get this guy Evan Shaeffer; Yesterday the kid wins the lotto and today some looney bitch b locks traffic and he avoids the worst pile up in years. I should be so damn unlucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly, Nora, Tim, Kat, Eugene and Rory now seem affect they've heard. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's true? What if it's happening all over again? The fluorescent light above FLICKERS ominously. Nora, dis stands up in a huff, grabbing Tim's arm. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all certifiable, you know that? I can't believe I've been listening to this crap. Come on, Tim, let's go outside. TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, Mom, stop trippin'. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look lady, we're just yankin' your chain. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're acting like we all just got the Diff'rent Strokes curse or something. Eugene and Rory burst out laughin g. Nora shakes her head NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you people? Nora pulls a reluctant Tim out of the room. As she opens the others watch Detective Suby and Thomas appear from no calm her down . When the door swings shut, an awkward sil Suddenly, the door opens again and Thomas leads Mr. Burro Mr. Burroughs sees Kimberly and chokes back tears. MR. BURROUGHS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly... The sight of her fath er crying is enough to make Kimberl burst. She rushes over to him and buries her head in his sobbing. MR. BURROUGHS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take her home? Thomas nods. DETECTIVE SUBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, you can all go. By now, the fluorescent light flickers out of control. Wh and Eugene stand up, Thomas looks helpless. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First I'm stuck with Jury Duty, now this nonsense. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hate to love and leave ya, but I've been over this X-Files shit since the sixth season. As Thomas watches them file out, the fluorescent light PO DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly sits at the table. Mr. Burroughs sets down a cup before her. Both are shaken. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's crazy, but I'm really scared for the others. I've got this terrible feeling. MR. BURROUGHS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What feeling? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That it's not over yet. She picks up the tea, it clatters in her trembling hands. MR. BURROUGHS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don 't worry. Everything will be fine, you'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dingy singly light bulb illuminates the narrow stairwel appears in the darkness, carrying a brand new television packages on top. He's unable to s ee the long rickety sta climbs. The stairs are littered with Chinese take out MENUS and a apparently left by some kids. As Evan slowly climbs the staircase, a FAT MAN comes down Evan to lean against - THE RAILING - which CREAKS and BENDS. After the FAT MAN p slowly continues up again, TEARING HIS SHIRT on a nail. EVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker. A HEATING DUCT CLICKS ON. The air blows a TONKA TRUCK slo the center of the staircase, directly in Evan's path - bu misses it! He continues past MORE TOYS, nearing the top stair - The Airduct coughs, sending menus fluttering toward Evan' he slips on them! He juggles the TV - but ultimately righ and continues down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim, cheap, probably roach-infested. As Evan enters, the packages fall off the TV box and onto the floor. Evan places the TV by the door, looks at his torn shirt, who cares; he's on a natural high. He peels his shirt off his PIERCED NIPPLES, flicks on the radio and DANCES his w the fridge and grabs a drink. In the tiny kitchenette area, a small swarm of flies hove grease-filled frying pan. Evan recoils, throws open the window and throws the greas sidewalk five stories below. An ominous BREEZE enters -- And a kitchen cabinet slowly BLOWS OPEN. Some FORKS and K forward on poorly stacked plates. Daring to fall into the Evan spills some cooking oil on the range while pouring i frying pan, then dumps in some frozen mozzarella sticks. the frying pan on the stove and turns it on HIGH. He then grabs a container of CHINESE FOOD and rests it on next to the fridge. On the fridge, several colorful MAGNE HEY E. PUSH IN on the H - which mysteriously drops into the Chin the word EY E remaining. Oblivious, Evan puts the food in microwave and turns it on.

dialogues.speaker: STOVE
dialogues.text: The cooki ng oil creeps toward the range... Evan hits PLA answering machine and rushes across the room to tear open packages... VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude! You suck! You buy one fucking ticket in your whole life and win twenty grand? We're going whoring in Prague, you know this! (whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, the boss is coming. A CLICK, then hold MUZAK: AC/DC's HIGHWAY TO HELL. ANGLE ON MAGNET in Chinese fo od. SPARKING. It pops and f ugly sound. As many similar messages continue, Evan unwraps a new ROL slides it over his wrist, admiring it.

dialogues.speaker: KNIFE
dialogues.text: Lazily sliding off the shelf and into the toaster, protru an inch and a half. Hardly noticeable. By now, Evan has opened the next package; a gaudy gold an encrusted horseshoe ring. He carries the ring into the kitchenette, sees the Chines FLAMING, and his hands flash out to turn it off -- A SMAL from the microwave startles him. The RING falls into his drain/garbage disposal! EVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! Evan reaches INTO THE DRAIN, his fingers searching for th he tries to pull his hand back out, the ROLEX CATCHES. Another small EXPLOSION from the microwave, this one crac GLASS. A Solo Plastic Cup nearby begins to melt. Flames sputter around the rim of the frying pan. In momen from the pan IGNITES. A small fire. Evan sees all this and YANKS with all his might. No use. slowly spreads to nearby cereal boxes, Evan starts to pan continues yanking... Stuck. He sees a bottle of PALMOLIVE on the other end of the cou fingers reach for it. Slightly out of his grasp. But his fingertips are just lo knock the bottle backwards - where it rests against TWO S The FIRE ALARM goes off. The PHONE RINGS. Evan desperately lifts his leg and tries to use his foot Palmolive over. By pushing the bottle up against the wall threatens to turn on one of the switches.

dialogues.speaker: FINGERS
dialogues.text: In the GARBAGE DISPOSAL. A SWITCH is flipped - but the li And the Palmolive lazily falls, resting on the remaining EVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on... Evan makes one last push with his foot - accidently flipp SWITCH - the GARBAGE DISPOSAL GRINDS METAL! Evan, horrified, miraculously yanks his hand free, brushi the knife in the toaster. When the SHOCK goes through Evan's body, his other hand j knocking the flaming frying pan to the floor. The entire kitchen is in flames, including the new TV blo door. The window slams SHUT! The room fills with smoke. EVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Evan grabs a fire extinguisher. A mere dribble of foam co begins COUGHING in the smoke. Evan tries the window - STUCK! He has no choice but to sm kitchenette window with the fire extinguisher to get to t escape. He dr ops the fire extinguisher, starts to climb out the a creak and looks up just as -- A large jagged shard of glass comes CRASHING down at him jumps back just in time as it shatters before him. The fi completely engulfs the kitchen. He bravely jumps through the window pane, landing on the He runs down the fire escape from floor to floor. A LARGE BLAST from his window showers him with glass and shrapnel, but ultimately, he makes it to the fire escape' level, intact. He tries to lower the rusty metal ladder to the ground. I once, then twice, but won't go down. So he climbs over th and gently drops to the ground. Safe and sound, he breathes a sigh of relief and turns to SUDDENLY he s lips on the very grease he threw out the wi legs shoot out from under him and he lands on his back. The rusty ladder suddenly dislodges and hurls downward -- right for Evan's face -- but stops halfway! As Evan laughs, breathing a final sigh of relief, it sudd PLUMMETS again -- impaling Evan through his eye socket!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas sits at the computer terminal. He checks to make s watching as he enters a SEARCH for Alex Browning. Ten websites come up, all devoted to the Flight 180 Curse scrolls around, seeing the death pix and autopsy photos o "survivors". Headlines blare, "Freak Accident?" "Bizarre Coincidence?" the way the victims died. As Thomas begins a localized se word, "PREMONITION" -- SPOOKY HUMMING from behind him. Thomas whirls around to see Det. Suby looking over his sh humming the music from an old monster movie. Suby presses his forehead, the other polishing an apple against his ve DETECTIVE SUBY (as if entranced)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh, I see it now. Your future... A transfer to another department. Suby bites the apple, casually offering nothing more. Tho embarrassed, flicks off the computer, stands. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made your point. DETECTIVE SUBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Cause we just got some new info and I don't ne ed you getting freaky on me. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? DETECTIVE SUBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan Shaeffer's dead. Guess he wasn't as lucky as we thought. Detective Suby shrugs and walks away, munching the apple. looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat cradles a phone to her shoulder. She watches televisi crushes Oreos into a bowl of ice- cream. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mom. Just turn on any station, they've been playing it all day. (beat; rolls her eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mother. Channel four will do just fine. Here it is, gotta go. She hangs up the phone, mesmerized by the report: FOOTAGE FROM A HELICOPTER shows the pile up wreckage. ANCHOR MAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Route 18 was backed up for almost nine hours today when a record breaking pile up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora and Tim watch the same report. ANCHOR MAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...killed An estimated 18 people. Emergency crews spent hours sifting through the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene looks up from grading midterm bluebooks to watch. ANCHOR MAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...hoping To recover any survivors from this tragic collision. So far, the police are refusing to release the names of the victims until their families are notified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Burroughs numbly watches the same report. He doesn't enter behind him from the kitchen. ANCHOR WOMAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera of a highway patrol car managed to catch this shocking footage -- B/W CAMERA FOOTAGE from Thomas' car shows Thomas tackling the ground just as a jack -knifed truck plows into the SU MR. BURROUGHS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord... A GASP from behind him. Mr. Burroughs spins to see Kimber back tears and picks up the remote, prepared to click of but she stops him. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.   I have to see this. Mr. Burroughs reluctantly keeps the newscast on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a party. Rory, surrounded by BUDDIES, shakes a trium at the television. HE WHOOPS with delight, spilling popco everywhere. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoohoo! You see that shit? Right there? That's my fuckin' car right there! Oh God, that's dope. After high-fiving his peeps, he bends to table level and freshly chopped line. ANCHOR MAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other news, a freak accident took the life of a lotto winner. Rory looks up to see the DMV photo of Evan. As he takes i report, his mood radically shifts. He looks like he's bee train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of Kimberly, Nora, Tim, Eugene and Kat watching. They all news very hard as the FOOTAGE shows Evan's BODY being car EMT workers. Eugene, however, shakes his head sadly but g grading blue books.

dialogues.speaker: TIM'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Tim's eyes are glued to the latest Stephen King novel. No NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Tim, lights out already. Tim starts at her voice, then reluctantly puts down the b TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think... You think those guys were b.s.-ing us today or what? Nora swallows, trying to seem brave. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please. Some people just need some serious rewiring, that's all. But neither of them are convinced. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some sleep. Nora kisses his forehead and leaves the room. After she l opens his nightstand drawer, pulls out a dusty nightlight it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora closes her bedroom door. And locks it. She nervously closet and even lowers the blinds. Finally, she takes out card and dials a number. She hangs up, then dials again. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Burke, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Burroughs tucks a still-shaken Kimberly into bed. In hands is a nearly empty glass of scotch. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Dad. I'm not ten anymore. Mr. Burroughs catches himself being overprotective. MR. BURROUGHS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm just so happy that you're safe. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Dad.     Goodnight. But Mr. Burroughs isn't ready to leave. He finishes his d MR. BURROUGHS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, after your mother died... Kimberly tenses, bracing for the worst. MR. BURROUGHS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were so many times I didn't think I could last another day. I can't even tell you some of the things I th ought about. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to have those feelings, too. But that's when I'd think of Mom. Her strength...and courage. And I'd pray that maybe I'd grow up to be as brave as she was. And the bad thoughts would go away. MR. BURROUGHS (choking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'd do if I lost you. Mr. Burroughs leans over, kisses her forehead and leaves. he's out the door, he braces at the distant sound of a CA out of control. The ENDLESS SCREECH is nerve shattering. Burroughs stands frozen, tensing for the inevitable crunc is none. And he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark except for one burning candle. Kimberly turns. The wind sends a single branch scraping against he porch swing SQUEAKS back and forth. Adding to her anxiety A BREEZE ENTERS, sputtering out the candle. Kimberly sits bed and sees the WINDOW IS SHUT. Huh? She lights a match candle wax dripped onto her table, forming the gooey shap a...180? The match goes out in her hand. The room is dark Headlights fr om passing cars cast eerie shadows on her c Shadows resembling PLANES seem to transform into a SKULL. Kimberly, freaked out, looks around to see the blinking l the VCR: it flashes 18:0 a few times, then 12:00. She can't take it anymore. She yanks the VCR cord from th flicks on the lights, ridding the room of shadows. And an turns on her computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly drives a beat up Hyundai through an eerie mornin surrounds the grounds of the Stoneybrook Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A computer printout in the shotgun seat: MAPQUEST directi "Stoneybrook Hospital". As Kimberly drives through the gate, the mist almost seem her inside. A SIGN offers a choice between "Emergency/Medica l Care" "Psychiatric Treatment Center." Kimberly drives to the me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PHYSICIAN in a lab coat leads a nervous Kimberly down t a long corridor. The Physician consults a clipboard. PHYSICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...at the request of the patient, you are to relinquish any sharp objects such as nail files, pencils, pens, safety pins, bobby pins, no matches, lighters, belts, belt buckles, earrings, chokers, shoelaces... Kimberly watches carefully as the Physician comes to a do punches "4514" into the electronic lock. They continue do corridor. Lights flicker,patients cackle and moan in the B.G. PHYSICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...paper clips, watches, food, drinks, keys, poisons, pills and medications. (looks at Kimberly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a cell phone on you? Kimberly nods, hands it over. PHYSICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I think we're all done. They arrive at a door to a padded room. The Physician pun another code. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Is she...dangerous or something? PHYSICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No honey, but she expects you are. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, how long are you going to keep her locked up this way? PHYSICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on her, I guess.   She's voluntary. The door hisses open.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL CLEAR RIVERS
dialogues.text: While still beautiful, this young woman bears few traces former self. Her eyes dart around suspiciously, maddened paranoia. Her hair is patchy, her eyes dark and haunted. savage. Her movements are fidgety, erratic, always distra something unseen. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear Rivers? Clear looks Kimberly up and down and steps back, allowing her inner sanctum. A mattress on the floor, a plastic bot water, some paperbacks and a bedpan. Kimberly's jaw drops when she sees the far wall: a SHRINE 180. The wall is papered with art icles about all the sur seen in the opening title montage). The door SLAMS. Kimberly jumps. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly Burroughs, eh?    What do you want? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought...I thought you might be able to help me. CLEAR (snicker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, how? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a premonition about the Route 18 pile up. .. I saved some people. And now I think Death is after me. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work. Maybe if you're real lucky, you'll wind up in here with me. (gives Kimberly the once over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I doubt you'll survive that long. Kimberly flinches. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just about me. Someone I saved died last night in a freak accident. What if the others are in danger, too? CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you put them on the list, they're already tits up. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What list? CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death's list. The precise order you're going to die in. Clear's eyes bore into a terrified Kimberly's. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The survivors of Flight 180 died in the exact order they were originally meant to die in the plane crash. That was Death's original design. KIMBERLY (sudden realization)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exact order? Then I'm next! I was meant to die with my friends, so I'm next! Clear backs away from Kimberly as if she were lethal, the short. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said someone else died last night. That means Death skipped past you. Someone must have intervened. (off Kimberly's confusion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometime yesterday you must have nearly died, but someone saved you. Kimberly nods, recalling the events. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Burke pulled me away from the crash that killed my friends. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratufuckinglations. That makes you last to go. But don't worry, once the others are dead, it'll come back for you. Always does. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That still doesn't make sense. You said you die in the same order you were originally meant to. But Evan Shaeffer died last in my premonition, not first. Clear seems very disturbed by that. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's moving backwards?    Are you sure? Kimberly reluctantly strains to remember something...

dialogues.speaker: THE FINAL MOMENTS OF THE PILE UP
dialogues.text: Nora's Pacer folds like an accordion, then EXPLODES, foll screaming in the Trans Am, which gets CREAMED by the semi

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Kimberly, shaken, does the math. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. In my premonition that Nora woman and her kid died first, then Evan and then...my friends. Clear is oblivious when Kimberly breaks into silent sobs. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backwards...that's new. Clear sees Kimberly crying and softens. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. Get all your tears out now, you'll need your eyes. (off Kimberly's confusion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the signs. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signs? CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have the same power as Alex, you'll be seeing signs soon. When you see anything creepy or ominous, an in-your- face irony kinda thing? Don't ignore it. It usually means the difference between life and death. KIMBERLY (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The songs on the radio. (to Clear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But wait. I don't understand.       Why is this even happening to me? CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what Alex used to ask himself right up until... For an instant, we see a gentle side of Clear. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's obvious you know what you're talking about. You beat it. You have to help us. Clear suddenly toughens up, an abrupt mood shift. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't beat it; I hid from it. If you were smart you'd put a down payment on a burial plot and say goodbye to the dog, because what little life you have left is over as you know it. Don't make new friends, don't fall in love, and don't ever bother trying to save others. That's the worst killer of them all. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say that?    What kind of monster are you? At once, Clear, enraged, is in her face, speaking through teeth. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family is dead.   My friends are dead. And Alex... Clear angrily peels a Polaroid off the wall and shows it While we don't see the photo, Kimberly's horrified face p gruesome picture on its own. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yes, that's the blade of a fucking ceiling fan in his head. Clear pounds on the door, apparently done with Kimberly. opens the door. Kimberly, devastated, turns to leave, the her courage and turns back to Clear. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what? I think you're a coward. I think you hide out in here because you're too damn bitter and selfish to care about another living soul. In my opinion, you're already dead. Kimberly leaves, giving Clear something to think about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kimberly pulls into her driveway, she's surprised to s CAR parked there. Then -- THOMAS, wearing street clothes, peers through the front w house. He guiltily backs away as Kimberly gets out. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried calling last night but your father -- KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan Shaeffer's dead. Thoma s nods and leans against the large glass windows th the sky behind them. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I've gotten calls all morning from everyone who was on the onramp. We're all meeting at my apartment tonight. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you believe all this?? That Death is working off a list? Thomas hesitates before answering. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. Until I was dispatched to clean up one of the Flight 180 survivors. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean up? I don't... Suddenly through the reflection of the window glass, Kimb hundreds of pigeons dive bomb her at once! Like a scene out of THE BIRDS, Kimberly must duck and cov pigeons assault her from every angle. But when Kimberly turns away from the reflection, toward pigeons, THEY'RE GONE. ALL IN HER HEAD. KI MBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that?? Thomas, concerned for her, saw nothing. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pigeons... It's a sign! If Clear's right about the order, then Nora and Tim are going to be attacke d by Pigeons! THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not following you -- KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're next on the list.   We have to find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman's N ike shoe on a down-moving escalator. Reveal Nor son Tim to a dentist's office. The SHOELACE snags on a bo the steel side panels, untying it... TIM (mischievous smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think the tooth fairy's gonna come tonight? I'm thinkin' like fifteen bucks. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice try, kiddo. Tim smiles, then winces from the pain in his mouth. THE DANGLING SHOELACE heads straight for the escalator gr SWALLOWED UP. As Tim steps off, Nora TRIPS forward. Her c sneaker is pulled tighter into the innards of the metal s TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! Tim watches helplessly as Nora reaches down, tug ging at fear mounting. Tim also grabs her sneaker and yanks. Fina shoelace SNAPS, and Nora's free again. TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Nora puts on a brave face and begins tying one long shoel stubby one. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure hon. I'm fine.   Let's shake it, we're late. Tim nods. The wind picks up as they continue past a --

dialogues.speaker: CONSTRUCTION CREW
dialogues.text: Who apply industrial suction cups to large, thick sheets GLASS . Tim stares in childlike fascination as they pass JACKHAMM CEMENT MIXER, and an EXCAVATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear Rivers applies fun- tack to the back of a newspaper sticks it on the wall devoted to Flight 180.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: A photo of Eva, "Lotto Winner Killed By Ladder". Clear backs away, pausing to look at a group photo of the of Flight 180 just before take off. Smiling faces. TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so much. Dr. Lees keeps a skeptical smile to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RECEPTIONIST appears next to the fallen fish food wit She plugs it in an outlet below the fishtank. A startling GRIND as the vacuum turns on and coughs up a vacuums up the fish food around Nora's feet. The DEAD FISH gets sucked into the water filter in the fi sputters and stops. The water level RISES, spilling water side of the tank. The water TRICKLES closer to the outlet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas drives his car into a friendly neighborhood. Kimbe shotgun, hangs up her cell phone. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around. The cleaning woman said they're at the dentist's. 14th and Main. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Thomas expertly skids into a U-turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks petrified as Dr. Lees unveils a tray full of PI and EXTRACTING FORCEPS. The KA-CHUNG of construction outside makes it im possible concentrate, but, hands trembling slightly, Dr. Lees pick and mirror and starts examining Tim's mouth. CU of PIC ge prodding Tim's teeth. DR. LEES (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little disappointed, Tim. Does your mom know you've been smoking? Tim groans "uh-uh", then suddenly flinches. DR. LEES (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that'll have to be filled. A BANG from the window startles Dr. Lees. His HAND JERKS, the pic was removed from Tim's mouth. Dr. Lees whips around in time to see a PIGEON flutter awa window. DR. LEES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Every day at the same damn time. Now this'll only sting for a moment. Dr. Lees picks up a large SYRINGE and moves it toward Tim mouth. DR. LEES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open big. Wiiiiider... Tim's eyes radiate fear. The MOUTH OPENS. Reluctantly. Ti eyes the window as the needle enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEEDLE heading toward his gumline -- BANG! Another pigeon takes a header into the reflection. hand jerks, nearly jabbing Tim's tongue. Tim squirms viol Lees looks towards the window angrily. DR. LEES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do they expect me to... Would you rather have the laughing gas? Tim nods his head ferociously. DR. LEES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean?     I need you in here. (waits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean continues vacuuming. The vacuum makes contact with N

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a minute, Dr. Lees angrily switches on two compress and Nitrous Oxide. By now, the NO mask has been attached around Tim's nose. drifts off, Dr. Lees lowers a DRILL into his mouth. DR. LEES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open big. Wiiiiiider. Excruciating SOUNDS of the drill going through enamel.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY AND THOMAS
dialogues.text: Racing to the medical complex throughout.

dialogues.speaker: THE WAITING ROOM
dialogues.text: The WATER TRICKLES into the outlet. The vacuum sparks and as --

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN DR. LEES' OFFICE
dialogues.text: BANG! SFX: BROKEN GLASS - it sounds like a pigeon finally through the window. In the other room. DR. LEES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it already. Dr. Lees marches out of the room to investigate. Another electrical surge and the OXYGEN COMPRESSOR flutters off. drops. But the NITROUS flow remains strong.

dialogues.speaker: FISH MOBILE
dialogues.text: Spinning from a new breeze. Suddenly, a small round PUFFE directly into Tim's mouth. Soft, gurgling and choking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora stares at a pigeon with a broken wing frantically tr right. Dr. Lees makes a half- hearted attempt to soothe a

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN DR. LEES' OFFICE
dialogues.text: SLOW DOLLY up to Tim. Choking, gurgling. His eyes are ope rolled up. His hand limply reaches up...then drops. Sounds of commotion in the next room seem to fade away as our SLOW DOLLY into Tim's eyes. They GLAZE OVER...the choking stops. And a HAND reaches i and pulls the puffer fish out of Tim's mouth. REVEAL JEAN looking petrified at the close call, looking make sure nobody saw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora and Tim, feeling better now, walk past the CONSTRUCT CRANE OPERATOR smiles at Tim, who smiles back. From across the mall, the tiny running figures of Kimberl appear in the dis tance, pointing and screaming. TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing here? And why are they yelling "pigeons"? Just then, Tim and Nora walk into a large cluster of PIGE suddenly burst into flight, startling the Crane Operator, inadvertently jerks a lever - A METALLIC CHAIN RATTLE fills the air and Tim looks up ju SHEET OF GLASS PLUMMETS downward toward him and CRUSHES h mangled body visible underneath. As two pearly whites roll around on the sidewalk, NORA SC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency vehicles everywhere. Thomas seems exhausted as back to Kimberly, who stands by his car. In the BG, EMTs stretcher into an ambulance. THOMAS (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora's not coming. She refuses to leave her son. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to tell her she's in danger! THOMAS (sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. And right now, I don't think she cares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas' car turns into the driveway and parks. Kimberly h hand and watches it tremble. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's happening again.   It's fucking happening again. I hoped we'd get there and they'd be okay, that Clear Rivers was full of shit and Evan's death was just a freak accident... Thomas kills the engine to listen. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're all going to die. We can't stop it. It's just a matter of time. I'm so scared. Thomas takes her hand and squeeze s it reassuringly. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am too. But you can use that fear. It'll sharpen your instincts. Keep you alert fro signs. It's the only way you'll be able to sav e the others...and me. Kimberly, seeming overwhelmed, pulls her hand back. Thoma he's losing her, and softens her approach. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you didn't ask for any of this, Kimberly. But I don't think you have it in you to quit either. Kimberly stares straight ahead, the weight of the world s BANG! A startling pound on the roof of Thomas' car. Kimberly jumps, then spins around to see: CLEAR RIVERS - standing in the driveway. A determined, po presence. Kimberly exits the car. A MOMENT where Kimberly stare each other down. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear/Thomas. Thomas/Clear. Clear nods absently to Thomas, still focused on Kimberly. KIMBERLY (bitter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second one just dies.   A 16 year old kid. CLEAR (nods; a faint trace of guilt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're ready for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas' car pulls into a partially filled parking lot. Ki Thomas and Clear file out and head to the door. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is cheery. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this guy, anyway? CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mortician. He seemed to know a hell of a lot more about death than he ever told us. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we knock? CLEAR (looking ill)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He probably already knows we're coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly, Thomas and Clear open the large wooden doors in chapel, creat ing a loud CREAK. A corpse in an open caske front of the chapel, post -wake. Kimberly, Thomas and Clear are forced to walk around the get to a side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three slowly edge towards a room at the end of a cree An ORANGE GLOW flickers from the far room. The unmistakab a furnace make it all the more eerie. As they near the door, they're able to see inside the roo shadow of a figure looms against a steel oven. They edge closer. They peek inside the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oddly there is no one there. As they enter, passing the f momentary WHOOSH of flames startles them all! They jump back - bumping right into: MR. BLUDWORTH, the dark, sinister mortician from FD1, who inexplicably appear BEHIND THEM. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Clear. I've been keeping an eye out for you. The mortician rolls a metal gurney carrying EVAN'S EYELES toward the firing oven. Kimberly and Thomas are scared. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. That's Evan Shaeffer. Clear, however, seems to expect nothing less. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to... Pick my brain? The Mortician slides a gleaming set of medical pliers int mouth. And YANKS out a gold tooth. Kimberly recoils as he the bloody tooth on a metal tray. MORTICIAN (to Kimberly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flesh and bone require 1,600 degrees for cremation. Gold, prosthetics and other metals must be removed before the final -- CLEAR (not falling for this again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a simple question and we'll leave you alone with your new friend. The Mortician grins; he likes the new Clear. He crosses t hits a LEVER. KA- CHUNK! The oven begins to blaze. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire away. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you cheat Death once and for all? The Mortician, recrossing the room, passes Kimberly and s to sniff, no INHALE, a terrified Kimberly's essence. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead.   But still fresh. Kimberly shudders as the Mortician moves back to Evan's b has had about enough. CLEAR (to the Mortician)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we drove a long way to get here. So if you happen to know how to get this death monkey off our backs, it sure would be swell if you told us. The Mortician now CLAMPS THE PLIERS around Evan's NIPPLE MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what purpose? You seek a back way out of a room with but one door. You can't cheat Death; there are no escapes. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You told me Death has a distinct design, a blueprint, unalterable. But Alex and I cheated Death not once, but dozens of times. If the design is flawed, it can be beaten. A sick smile crosses the Mortician's lips. He yanks the n OFF! Kimberly looks on both horrified and awed when Clear flinch back from the pliers, where a bloody nub dangles. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such fire in you now. People are always most alive just before they die. Don't you think? Clear steps back from him, hate flashing in her eyes. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can be beaten.   And you know it. CREEEAAAK -SLAM! The Mortician rolls Evan's body into the MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some say that there is a balance to everything. An equilibrium that is the connective tissue of the universe. They say that for every lif e there is a death, and for every death a life... His words hang in the air. An ominous BREEZE enters. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solus novus anima licet evinco mortis; Only new life can defeat death. (off their confusion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The list of life is forever set by the Divine Plan, the guiding hand that plots the course of the universe, down to its tiniest element s. Thomas looks to Clear; what's he talking about? The Morti on Kimberly as if the others had ceased to exist. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The list accounts for every life; from the dawn of man to the great apocalypse. But the introduction of life that was not meant to be, a soul forbidden to roam the earth, that could invalidate Death's list, shatter its very existence. Evan's other eye POPS , startling Thomas and Kimberly. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean? MORTICIAN (with finality)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To figure that out you'll have to follow the sign s. The Mortician grabs Kimberly. MORTICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But be warned. To disrupt the grand design is to unravel the tapestry of the universe. When you pull all the threads apart, you may find yourself hanging from them. The Mortician finally lets Kimberly go. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last question. Why is Death working backwards this time? The Mortician glances at his watch - Evan's bran d new Ro MORTICIAN (shakes head; a sick smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, time's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the nozzle in Thomas' car. Thomas fills the tank, wa signs of danger. Clear's hand is poised over the gas pump

dialogues.speaker: CUT-OFF VALVE
dialogues.text: Some SKATE RATS exit the mini -mart with a pack of Camels Kimberly, who carries a couple of Red Bulls and hands the THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New life defeats death? Follow the signs? Where the hell did you find that guy? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought he was supposed to be helpful. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was. If we can use your ability to see the signs, we can cheat Death long enough to figure out what "new life" means. (off their looks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it worries me that I understand him. Thomas tops off the tank. Some gas spills to the ground. all around -- sure enough, one of the Skate Rats is about match. CLEAR'S HAND SLAPS the kid in the back of the head, stopp motion. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you thinking? The startled Skate Rat shrinks back from Clear's rage. SKATE RAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinkin', suck my junk, bee yatch. Thomas chuckles to himself and looks at Kimberly who --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV DRIVER. Grease-covered female hands reach out toward wheel of a white van speeding out of control TOWARD A LAK The van crashes through a railing and PLUNGES into the wa moments, the van fills with water, the driver inside trap Drowning. Horrible.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: Comes to Thomas' arms - GASPING uncontrollably for breath stricken. She begins hyperventilating. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What did you see? It's so bad, Kimberly can't speak. She coughs and gags as drowned. Clear scans the perimeter for immediate dangers.

dialogues.speaker: A POWER REPAIRMAN
dialogues.text: On a cherry picker messes with the transformer, a LAWN BO starts a WEED WHACKER close to broken glass, a MECHANIC o ladder changes out the gas price numbers, a female DOG WA three dogs approaches the ladder. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to tell us now. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: I...I...
dialogues.text: Clear shakes her head by the shoulders and barks commands angry drill sergeant. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're strong. Do you hear me? You're a fucking warrior. Nothing scares you. In fact you happen to be the single most powerful woman on earth. Now what did you see? The words slowly take affect. Kimberly becomes centered, breath back, and speaks without a hitch. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was driving a white van. It must've gone out of control because it crashed into a lake and I drowned. It was...horrible. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were there? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can practically taste the water in my throat. And something else. The smell of flowers... CLEAR (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it wasn't just a sign. It was a premonition? Thomas gently releases her, paces. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the onramp? There was a pregnant woman in a white delivery van. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. He said "only new life can defeat death." (off looks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she gives birth to a baby that was never meant to be born, a brand new soul that was never part of Death's Design... KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It throws the entire Death list out of whack. And a new list has to be rewritten f rom scratch. We all start over with a clean slate. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds all well and good, but what if we're wrong? CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, what else could it mean? KIMBERLY (to Thomas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if you give us the pregnant lady's number, we can warn her about the lake and she'll live long enough to have the baby. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's do it. THOMAS (realization)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I don't have her number. She was never interviewed. She took off right after the accident. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we going to find her? There must be thousands of white vans in this state. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm a police officer, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas works a VCR, scanning BACKWARDS through the video the patrol car camera. We see the SUV's explosive collisi jack- knifed semi. Kimberly is taken by surprise by the s crash. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... Thomas sees Kimberly and quickly flicks off the monitor. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh...sorry. Kimberly notices Clear watching her and toughens up. She the tears and qui ckly wipes the rest away. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. We need my eyes. Clear sits beside Kimberly. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right.    I'll take watch. Kimberly looks grateful, and a moment passes between them already buried the need to cry. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. Just caught me by surprise. Put it back on. Clear does, watching the cars seemingly pass in reverse. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure all these people will be at the meeting tonight. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: Back, back, back until the Patrol Car slowly creeps backw the onramp. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. Thomas hits play and we see footage from the patrol car c the White Van. A clean shot of the license plate. Jackpot As Thomas slides his chair to a data base and types in th number, the pause function dislodges, slowly advancing th by frame. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it. Why is everything happening so fast? After Flight 180. A month went by before anyone died. And now five people are dead in less than a day. Thomas' computer screen finally fills with information. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. The vehicle's a delivery van registered to Jorge and Isabella Cruz. And Christ, there's almost a dozen domestic disturbance complaints on these two. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to hurry. They all get up and leave. Ominously, THE MONITOR shows the NEXT VEHICLE creeping be Pacer - a white van!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas pulls up to an upper-middle class house. Thomas, K Clear get out and start up the unlit path. It's dark, har where they're going, so they negotiate by feeling the bus the walkway. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's lay this on her gently now. The stress alone could upset the pregnancy. Kimberly nods, ever creeping closer to the front door -- AUTOMATIC LIGHTS FLASH from over the garage. All three freeze for a moment, during which we hear STOMP from within the house, and the lights SHUT OFF. But nothing else happens. No one comes to a door. Thomas as if suddenly remembering his status, he walks fearlessl purposefully to the front door. He makes a fist, is about to knock - when the DOOR FLINGS ROTTWEILER LUNGES for his throat - only to have its colla the last second by its owner - JORGE CRUZ, late 30's, handsome, cocky. He speaks above R

dialogues.speaker: BARKING
dialogues.text: JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Officer Burke.    I'm looking for an Isabella Cruz. Suddenly, with an unexpected fury, Jorge SCREAMS at his d JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!!! The Rottweiler cowers, and Jorge shoves it to the floor, lands on its feet and fearfully trots away. Jorge's face again pleasant, but it's a thin veneer. Jorge sees Clear and Kimberly behind Thomas and frowns. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Jorge Cruz? JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.   What's this about? THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May we come in? JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   What's this about? ANGLE ON CLEAR - eyeing what appears to be DROPS OF BLOOD floor. She takes in what she can see of --

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOM
dialogues.text: As if a tornado had hit it. Wedding photos smashed and to Furniture over-turned. THOMAS (a little stern)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about your wife, Isabella. Now is she here? Jorge's eyes flicker ever -so- involuntarily behind him. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I'm alone. But by now, Thomas has seen everything Clear has and more through the house, into a bedroom and sees - A FEMALE FOOT lying half0buried under the bedspr ead. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, pal, it's probably nothing. But I need to see -- Jorge is already closing the door. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. You'll need a warrant. I know, I'm a lawyer. Clear rushes the door, shoulders it and expertly wriggles Jorge's grasp. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!!!   You can't go in there!!! Clear tears into the bedroom, grabs the bedspread and THR the floor to reveal a YOUNG WOMAN, naked, trembling with a closer look at Clear. YOUNG WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never meant to hurt you Isa...You're not Isabella! Meanwhile, Jorge yells at Thomas. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to sue your ass! KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose blood is that on the floor? Defensively, Jorge holds up his arm. Freshly cut. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine, you idiot. The dog went nuts this afternoon. Now arrest her! KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Isabella? Did you finally kill her you fucking wife beater? Jorge flinches. It's time to come clean. JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a fight. Some things got broken, the dog went crazy, she left me. Wouldn't say where she was going. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the fight about? JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a guess. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she have a cell phone?   A way we can contact her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did. He eyes a SHATTERED CELL PHONE on the floor. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're wasting time with this piece of shit. Let's just get to the meeting. Jorge turns to soothe the frightened Young Woman in the b JORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, when you find her, tell her the kid's half mine. Clear mutters something as they exit the house. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can only pray it doesn't come out retarded. Jorge hisses something at the Rotty, which CHARGES them a But Thomas slams the door on the frothing dog just in tim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rory sits in his Chevette outside an apartment building, at the address. He quickly snorts some powder off his key his nostrils free of crystals. He takes a breath and exit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rory follows some PEOPLE into the elevator. The elevator on his shoe -- trapping Rory in an awkward position. One MAN frantically pushes the DOORS OPEN button to no av Finally, as the elevator rises, Rory YANKS his foot free. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. I wrote to management two weeks ago about these friggin' bumpers. Rory bends down and inspects his shoe. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, is that dogshit? Rory briefly holds the shoe too close to the Man's face - before disgustedly slipping it back on. DING. The doors open. The man hurries out and the elevato CLOSE on Rory's smirking face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL - Nora, Rory, and Kat, mortified, sit on a couch. the bomb's been dropped, reality has set in. Clear and Ki their reactions. Nora raises a trembling hand. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anybody have a Valium? Kat opens her purse and hands her a blue pill. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll want to take -- Nora pops it in her mouth. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- half of that. Nora chews, her eyes half dead from bereavement. Across t Thomas paces, phone in hand. THOMAS (quietly, into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word yet on the Dodge van? Damn. Eugene alone seems unafraid. He uses a GRABBER - a long p movable claw on the end - to OPEN THE SKYLIGHT. When done balances the long pole precariously against the wall. An OMINOUS BREEZE enters. Clear notices MAGAZINE PAGES bl the desk by the couch. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that would mean... I'm next. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's next. This is crazy. First death's stalking us and now premonitions? KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be happening. My career's at a peak, I finally met a cute guy, I just bought a new house... RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shut the fuck up and maybe you'll live. Kat's hands ball into fists. The hatred is mutual. Clear a nearby cardboard box on the desk, noticing MAGAZINE PAG over until their weight tips over a PENCIL HOLDER which s out. She takes the box to Nora. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not next, Nora. Nobody has to be next. That's the point. Last time, we didn't plan. We weren't organized. Now we can help each other. She reaches into the box and passes out cell phones to No others. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think what would have happened if Kimberly had been able to warn you with the word pigeons... Nora's head falls. Kimberly senses her anguish and takes KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is, as long as you know what to beware of, you have a fighting chance. It can be beaten. If I call you and say subway, get to a high rise fast. A place where no subway could possibly go, get it? Everyone nods in understanding. Rory fidgets, sniffling, the table in frustration. Startling Kat. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell did I ever get on Route 18 in the first place? That's me, Mr. Dumb Fucking Luck. Clear, very alert, looks at the tipped PENCIL HOLDER. PEN toward the end of the desk, toward a large White Pages di which hangs precariously off the edge just so. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone read today's paper?   The article on Evan Shaeffer? No one says a word. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only reason he was on Route 18 was because he own the lottery and had to collect the winnings. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lucky bastard. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the rest of you? Kimberly, you were driving to Daytona. Was Route 18 your first choice? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new freeway was faster, but Route 18 was the way my mom used to take, so... They take turns going around the room. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Route 18 is Drake's assignment, but he called in sick so I got... (blanches)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake's never sick. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was my first day of jury duty. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jury duty? That's randomly selected by social security numbers. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Random, sure. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you think Death planned for each of us to die in the pile up weeks ago? You're nuts. Clear fumes. Rory looks ill and reaches into his wallet. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last July I dialed a wrong number and got a radio station by accident. They asked me what number means "good luck" in Jewish. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen. And it's "Hebrew". RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I guessed it right and won these. Rory holds up two Yankee tickets. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best way to get to Yankee Stadium is Route 18. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's weirder, the dialing a wrong number part or that Death would set you up nine months in advance. THOMAS (realization)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, nine months? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you thinking what I'm thinking?

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLA'S PREGNANT BELLY.
dialogues.text: REVEAL she's lying down, binging on take- out food, while the motel phone. A disturbing metallic SQUEAK SCRAPE -SQU heard, nearly drowning out the SCREAMING COUPLE next door ISABELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'd like to report a domestic squabble - my name? Isabella Cruz why, does it matter? I'm at the Super 8 motel. Yes, I own a white van. So what? Just get over here. Isabella hangs up, recoiling at VIOLENT THUMPS against he BACK AND UP TO REVEAL the source of the unsettling SQUEAK rickety, wobbling CEILING FAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly whispers into the phone. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Dad, we're having a hard time with Shaina's eulogy. I'll stay here at Virginia's tonight and see you tomorrow. I love you too. She hangs up, looking guilty for having lied to her fathe keeps her eyes on the pens that ROLL on the slightly cant into the about-to -fall White Pages directory. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember everyone, just because Kimberly's got the power doesn't mean we're not all capable of seeing signs to some extent. The pens softly tap the phone book one by one until it la over and PLOPS HEAVILY onto a GOOSE-DOWN THROW PILLOW. Small feathers from the pillow are carried upwards by the Everyone in the room watches them rise. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like Forrest Gump. They float across the room, ultimately landing on a MOUSE The trap flies over and knocks into the base of the unsta - which tips and slowly slides down the wall. Clear, in a chair, looks directly above her head at a LAR mounted on the wall. The Grabber picks up speed, arcs downward and hits the mo SWORDFISH. The supporting brackets give, causing the SWOR and SLIDE DOWNWARD! Clear lurches back in her chair just in time - the razor impales the seat cushion between her legs! CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Should have seen that coming. The institution's made me soft. Clear gets up, carefully easing herself around the swordf isn't quite sure what to make of what he's just seen. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Death has got such a hard-on for you, maybe you should get the hell away from us. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need her. She's the only one who's dealt with this before, idiot! Kimberly looks self-conscious by her outburst. Clear, how grateful. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all going to have to open our eyes from now on. Look out for each other. Sleep in shifts. (looks around apartment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we've got to safeproof this deathtrap.

dialogues.speaker: SAFEPROOFING THE APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Everyone but Nora and Eugene helps unplug appliances, put fire, take down hanging objects, switch off the gas, put objects away, affix padding to chart corners... Kat, placing poisonous cleansers and flammable liquids in nervously pulls out a pack of smokes. Thomas watches as h hanging mirror off the wall. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw this. I'm going outside for a smoke. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you should?     It's not safe out there. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? Nora's gotta bite it before me anyway, right? Kat steps towards the front door, then remembers the cell grabs it just in case. Thomas smiles 'good job' at her. Kimberly, unscrewing the light bulb, looks up when Nora r the couch in a stupor and struggles to put on her jacket. looks concerned. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going, Nora?    You okay? Nora fights the sleeve, dazed and defeated. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four years ago my husband died. Now Tim. There's nothing left for me. Kimberly stops pouring liquor down the drain. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that. Once you lose hope, it's already too late. Eugene snickers. Nora looks up, anger surfacing. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's my time to go, to be in heaven with my family, then I can accept that. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't give up. Don't accept Death's plan. Trust me, you can fight this. If we can just survive long enough until that baby is born, we can -- Nora looks more resolute than ever. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll excuse me, I have a funeral to prepare. Everyone looks crushed when Nora heads for the door. Exce who stands up as well. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why am I listening to a girl who just got out of the nut house? As Eugene heads out, Kimberly becomes enraged and grabs h KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing you die once was enough for me. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. I control my life, not fate. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be sure to put that on your tombstone. Rory presses a cell phone into Eugene's hand on his way o RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. And even if you don't believe, give this to Nora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene pushes the elevator button a thousand times. Nora ties her long hair back in a single braid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nervous group finishes safe-proofing the apartment. RORY, standing on the couch, pulls a POLICE ACADEMY DIPLO wall - and slips - stumbling BACKWARDS into the closet. Staggering, he accidentally knocks some COAT HANGARS and TROPHY from the high shelf to the floor. Thomas whips around and sees that Rory's not hurt. He the gaze and sees -- The figurine of a VOLLEYBALL TROPHY is framed by a tangle wire COAT HANGARS. Suddenly, STREETLIGHT FLICKERS ON for Oddly, it only illuminates the Trophy/Hangar array. From Rory's vantage point, it looks like a surreal sculpt with hooks emanating from his body. The sodium vapor lamp OMINOUS GLOW around the image. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...man with hooks. I see a man with hooks. Someone?!?! The others look over, trying to see what he does. THOMAS (unsure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kinda see it, yeah. So...Nora's going to be killed by a man with hooks? Kimberly and Clear stare at the volleyball trophy - the s ominously FLICKERS OUT AND DIES. Everyone looks around for a hesitant beat, then Thomas pi cell phone. Clear first walks, then RUNS out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator finally comes. Eugene and Nora get inside, s front of a gaunt looking man holding a cardboard box full PROSTHETIC LIMBS. MUZAK plays AC/DC's HIGHWAY TO HELL. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going down, right? The Gaunt Man says nothing. The DOORS CLOSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene stares blankly at the CONCAVE MIRROR in the upper disturbed by the WARPED REFLECTION OF: THE GAUNT MAN leans closer to Nora's hair and as the door close, he leans over and SMELLS it. Creepy. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, by the way, your shoe's untied. Nora bends down to tie her shoelace (the one that snapped tying the long dangling shoelace to the stubby one as Eug phone VIBRATES in his hand. Startled, he drops it to the looks embarrassed. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably for you, anyway. Nora picks it up. STATIC CRACKLES. It's hard to make out yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Burke?   I can't hear... A beat of confusion, then she slowly turns to see the cla and hands of the Prosthetic limbs. Terror. She freezes. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What's wrong? But Nora's too frightened to speak. Eugene grabs the phon unintelligible STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: CLEAR
dialogues.text: As she frantically hits the elevator button. When it fail she runs downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora slowly rises to her feet, feverishly mouthing a pray door opens, Nora rushes out - unseen to her, her long bra snagged on one of the PROSTHETIC HOOKS, YANKING her backw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go let me go! EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, watch it, you've caught your uh... The Guant Man's sweet voice and demeanor are a clear cont outward appearance. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodness gracious, darling, let me help you with... Nora panic,s as Eugene and the Man try to untangle her br desperately spins her body around, sticking her head back elevator. Kat appears in the lobby, smoking a cigarette. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright, Nora? The elevator DOORS begin to close, and CLAMP around Nora' head inside, body outside the elevator. Eugene pounds on the BUMPERS, but they don't seem to work

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, someone please let me out of this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The UP BUTTON is lit. Clear rushes to the lobby. The Elevator RISES! INSIDE THE ELEVATOR, Eugene watches Nora's head drop to f then he pounds the Emergency Button - which SHORTS OUT! Nora's body lifts upwards from the force of the elevator Nora's screams of terror and agony fill the air as the el repeatedly LURCHES UPWARDS. Kat gasps in horror to see this poor woman suspended abov It lurches. And lurches. And lurches. The horror never en Clear comes from the stairwell and is shocked by the sigh to the elevator doors, trying to pry them apart to no ava All Kat can do, crying, is grab hold of Nora's flailing l to pull her back down. The elevator lurches a final time. NORA'S HEADLESS BODY f into Kat's arms, knocking her to the floor. Kat freaks, s away as the body convulses.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Eugene balls his hands to his mouth in undeniable fear. A bloodcurdling moan escapes him. He stares transfixed as N still aghast in terror, rolls around the floor. The sight clearly sends Eugene over the edge. He SCREAMS, POUNDS, desperate to escape the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene suddenly bursts through the door, babbling incoher Kimberly, Thomas and Rory look on, bewildered. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no escapes my ass. I control my fate. I die on my terms, hear me Reaper cockscuker?! Eugene's in another world. He approaches Thomas and lunge GUN - yanking it from the holster! THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you...? EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't going out like that.   On my terms! THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take it easy! A twisted insane smile comes to Eugene's face as he jams gunbarrel to his temple. The others shrink back in terror He PULLS THE TRIGGER. CLICK! Eugene tries again. CLICK! Thomas looks stunned as Eugene goes through every round, CLICK CLICK CLICK CLI CK... Kimberly breaths a sigh of relief. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't keep it loaded? Thomas' eyes disagree. He reaches in and GRABS the gun aw Eugene, who stands there trembling. Thomas cracks open th Loaded. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they were all duds. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six in a row? Never. Impossible. That's like (sinking realization)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...winning the lottery. CLEAR (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't his turn to die. Everyone turns to see Clear and Kat, standing in the door DRENCHED IN BLOOD. Kat trembles uncontrollably. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we find the pregnant woman, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashing lights from rescue vehicles illuminate the livin the newly conformed safe house, Kat and Clear relax as be in Thomas' dry clothes. Thomas makes another phone call. In the corner, Eugene sh himself. Desperately looking for signs of danger. He look Clear. EUGENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Clear? I'm sorry...about before. I... CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your entire world view just went out the window. I couldn't expect a religious conversation overnight. We'll get through this. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. Eugene looks immensely relieved. Rory ambles over to Kimb typical callousness gone. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I die. Is it gonna hurt? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I don't know. Rory nods. He expected as much. He fishes his LICENSE and his pocket. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're gonna die after me, right? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so. RORY (re: keys and license)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you take these? And if I die... (tears well up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you throw all my drugs out? Paraphernalia, porno, you know... Anything that would break my mom's heart. Kimberly looks deeply into his eyes, looking for the punc she doesn't see one, she nods tenderly and takes the keys The PHONE RINGS. Rory jumps at the sound, paranoid eyes i Thomas answers, speaks softly, hangs up. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A one very pissed off Ms. Isabella Cruz is being detained up in Greenwood. Let's finish this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat's Ford Expedition winds its way through rural New Yor A SPORTS CAR speeds past on the left, then as it pulls in the Exped ition, its slipstream sucks over some debris fr shoulder; a thin metal piece of trim, which bounces in fr Expedition's left front tire. CU KAT'S WHEEL WELL -- the metal trim is shot upward into well, where it lodges firmly, its sharp metal edge GRINDI THE RUBBER.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: Kat drives, Thomas reading directions in the shotgun seat Eugene and Rory ride in back. In the CARGO area, Clear sc rear window for danger. Rory fidgets. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this safe, guys? I mean, someone in this car is about to get whacked. Do the rest of us really feel like sitting next to him? (off Kat's glare)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or her. Hopefully her. An uncomfortable beat. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, let's not panic.   Isabella's safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know? THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
