dialogues.text: You said she was going to drive into a lake. How can she when she's in protective custody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabella, pissed, is in a holding tank. Small town deputy ADAMS, 30's, CLEANS HIS GUN in her direction. ISABELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean "grand theft auto?" This is insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopefully the district judge can straighten it all out by Monday mor ning. ISABELLA (figures it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorge. When I get out of here I'm going to sue his cheating ass off. As she fumes, a rivulet of WATER streaks down her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Steve, at first confused, sees the water and gasps. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?!   Oh, man. He rushes across the room, pulls a lever, unlocking the c STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.    Let's go. As Steve throws on his jacket, we reveal its prominent em GREENWOOD LAKE SHERIFF DEPARTMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small town station. Only one patrol car. In the patrol ca buckles up in the sho tgun seat, the belt stretched tight belly. Deputy Steve tries the ignition, but the car won't start. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, they always stick me with the clunker. ISABELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my van!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAT'S EXPEDITION speeds through a yellow light and contin

dialogues.speaker: EXPEDITION'S LEFT TIRE
dialogues.text: Metal sheers away more rubber.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE EXPEDITION
dialogues.text: Rory, antsy, rubbing his nostrils, stares at two Yankee t RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what I don't get. For nine months, Death does all this shit to make sure I win these tickets and end up on Route 18 at exactly the right time for the pile up... KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why single me out? What am I in the great scheme of things? You'd think I stepped off Flight 180 or something... Fucking weird, man. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want weird? Last year, my partner and I were heading out for the graveyard shift. A call comes in about a train wreck and Frank decides to let me handle it alone. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank died that night in a shootout. I'd be dead too if that call had come in just ten seconds later. Everyone nods in that 'life's weird' reverence kind of wa KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got that beat. So like, last May, I was supposed to stay at this cheesy bed and breakfast in Pennsylvania. There was a major gas leak no one knew about and all the guests suffocated during the night. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so what happened? KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never mad it. The Greyhound bus I was on splattered some chick all over the road and we had to stop. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that in Mt. Abraham? KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   How did you know? CLEAR (sinking realization)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bus you were on? It killed Terry Mathers. She was supposed to die on Flight 180. KAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I-- THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. The call about the train wreck that saved my life? That was the night I scraped up Billy Hitchcock. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another kid from Flight 180. A chill passes over the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Steve speeds the White Van up the narrow winding r Isabella breathes Lamaze- style through intense pain. ISABELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me...I won't have the baby...in this van. Speeding up the incline, Steve tries to speed around a Vo Beetle, but cars scream by in the opposite direction. ISABELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get around it!!! Steve leans on the horn and stomps the gas, dangerously r shoulder around the Beetle. Way ahead of the Beetle, on the left side, is a LAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIAN GIBBONS, 15, cheerfully drives a TRACTOR hauling a across the high crest of the empty road toward a pile of branches. The Tractor unexpectedly stalls in the middle of the road the ignition, pumps the gas. Nothing... Only by standing on the tractor can Brian see the White V up the hill toward him. He jumps down and frantically tir the tractor. Once, twice, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU FRONT TIRE - METAL shreds away more rubber.

dialogues.text: Footage showing grieving families, wreaths on doors, yell and emergency crews pulling wreckage apart, dissolve toge ANCHOR    WOMAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mor e tears were    shed this morning in the wake of     yesterday's tragedy that rocked the     Tri -State area... Suddenly, the FRAYED ELECTRIC CORD of Eugene's TV begins The sound DROPS OUT, the picture SPUTTERS. Eugene goes white with terror. He looks back to -- The broken OXYGEN TUBE. HISSING softly. The BEEPS of the frantically increase. Eugene reaches for the nurse call s Mockingly out of reach by mere millimeters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear, Kimberly and Thomas dash toward the main desk. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabella Cruz.    What room's she in? RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I can't give out that info unless you're a relative. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm her sister. The Receptionist eyes her dubiously. RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to see your ID, Ms. Cruz. Clear vaults over the counter, straight-arms the Receptio seizes the computer. Thomas and Kimberly look on, stunned CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delivery rooms are downstairs. I'll find Eugene and catch up with you. Kimberly and Thomas hurry to the elevator banks...then re enter the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene scratches the top sheet of the bed, trying to inch switch closer and closer to him. But it won't budge. A RAT APPEARS behind Eugene's pillow, CRAWLS over his che disappears by his stomach! He pounds desperately on the empty food tray, his side ra toward the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the door, you can't hear a thing in the bustling people rush by. Kimberly and Thomas rush past his door, l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, I think she's this way.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO EUGENE
dialogues.text: His eyes scream insanely, but he respirator tube prevents from escaping him. And that's when the RAT appears on the begins gnawing on the respirator's power cord! When Eugene sees this, the EEG machine climbs off the cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear takes off down the hallway. The Receptionist, shake phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Obstetrician voices concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Isabella, I need you to stop pushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? IS the baby all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a breach. If I can't reverse it, we may need to do a Caesarian. The Obstetrician's hands go to work. Steve looks ill. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should step outside.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY AND THOMAS
dialogues.text: Running down the corridor. PA ANNOUNCEMENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Code Blue in Delivery Room 6.   Code Blue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rat GNAWS away at Eugene's power cord, Eugene looks t helpless, tortured. His eyes dart from the sparking TV to the gnawed power co useless call- switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear walks up and down the corridor, scanning room numbe passes. A -169, A- 171, A-173... CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: B-187...B-187...
dialogues.text: A HAND suddenly GRABS Clear and shoves her against the wa SECURITY GUARD leering at her. SECURITY GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just where do you think you're going? Clear struggles to get away, getting sympathetic looks fr MAN walking a rolling IV STAND down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabella is pushing again. OBSTETRICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost there. I see the head... The NURSE takes a pair of SCISSORS off a tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear plays possum, offering no resistance to the Securit the Old Man wheels his IV STAND along. Suddenly, Clear grabs the stand - and WHAMS the heavy whe into the Guard's BALLS! As the Guard recoils, she thought the IV back to the Old Man and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nurse is startled when Kimberly and Thomas BURST THRO door. In the BG, a puzzled Steve peeks inside until Kimbe the door closed. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in here?    Get the hell out! Right now! Finally we hear the BABY CRY! The Nurse immediately moves swaddle the newborn. Dr. Kalarjian beams at the very grog Isabella. OBSTETRICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabella, look down and see your son. To the confusion of everyone around them, Kimberly and Th INTO CHEERS! They jump, dance and hug each other. It's a magical moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RAT stops gnawing. The TV stops sparking. A wave of i relief washes over Eugene. He pantomimes reaching into hi pocket and lighting a victory cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relaxed and invigorated, Kimberly and Thomas giddily exit delivery room as Clear runs up to them. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guard grabbed me before I could find Eugene. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sweat it.   It's over. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had the baby? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New life defeats death. We've done it. Death has to rewrite the list. We're safe. Steve watches, confused, as Clear whoops with delight and others. Clear laughs with a relief that seems completely foreign Kimberly laughs with her, then is suddenly rocked by a vi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up a the EEG machine. Flatlined! THOMAS (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly! Are you okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly, on the ground, looks frazzled as she SNAPS out trance. Thomas helps her to her feet. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? You just face planted! KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how it feels to be dead. Her lips blue, Kimberly shivers uncontrollably. Clear see SECURITY GUARDS round a distant corner and quickly walks toward an EMERGENCY LOADING ZONE. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was dead. And came back to life. An EEG machine. Where's Eugene? THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's over. Isabella's baby was the key. You saw her die and everything, right? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...what if I made a mistake? THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible. She was on the onramp. Kimberly reluctantly closes her eyes and remembers.

dialogues.speaker: PREVIOUSLY UNSEEN
dialogues.text: Moment of the pile-up premonition. A WHITE VAN in fr ont suddenly slams on its brakes and pulls onto the shoulder. Kimberly screams, swerving around the van just in time to accident.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Kimberly, overcome with self- doubt. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure... I don't think Isabella was ever destined to die in the pile -up. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's the premonition of the lake supposed to mean? CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you remember anything about it? Kimberly shuts her eyes, remembering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grease-covered hands reach out toward a steering wheel of speeding out of control TOWARD A LAKE! The van crashes through a railing and PLUNGES into the wa moments, the van fills with water, the driver inside trap Drowning. Horrible. And on the rearview mirror, six floral scented AIR-FRESHN

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Kimberly looks down at her grease -covered hands and look KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the Same hands from the van. Finally everything makes sense to Clear. CLEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you Kimberly. The premonitions are about you. Kimberly trembles, refusing to accept what she's hearing. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   It can't be. CLEAR (suddenly remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to save Eugene! Clear leaves Kimberly and Thomas together. Kimberly verge and Thomas consoles her with a hug.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACKGROUND
dialogues.text: Clear looks at passing room numbers while hurrying down t She comes to a room with a HUGE CART parked outside, bloc door. She looks up to see - B -187. Clear leans into it, pushing it out of the way of the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene?    Are you in there?

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Eugene strains to hear through the thick door. CLEAR (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me? I'm coming in . An intense wave of relief washes over Eugene.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: As Kimberly hugs Thomas, she watches Clear push the cart door. ORDERLY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make way, make way lovebirds. Kimberly spins as Eugene's Orderly passes her; a paper, p crossword book in one hand, A BIRTHDAY CAKE in the other. The CAKE reads "Happy Birthday Gregory". The THIRTEEN SPA CANDLES on top ODDLY FRAME Clear's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... The Orderly speeds down the corridor toward Clear, whose for Eugene's door handle. She leans into it -- ORDERLY (to Clear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks hon, the Henzels are going crazy for this thing.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS AND KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: Watch as Clear opens the door, briefly revealing Eugene, Oxygen --

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Clear's body is obscenely hurled END OVER END towards the heading straight for Kimberly and Thomas! Thomas throws himself and Kimberly around the corner to p crushed by Clear's lifeless body! The hospital erupts in total chaos. Just as Kimberly is a break down completely, she sees -- A WOMAN hurrying down the hallway in their direction, pus cart. Kimberly sees the nametag: KALARJIAN. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Kalarjian... DR. KALARJIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Kalarjian. Excuse me, please.

dialogues.speaker: CART
dialogues.text: DEFRIBULATOR PADDLES rest on top. And then Dr. Kalarjian toward the area of the explosion. KIMBERLY OMINOUSLY TURNS, the camera following her view, sees a small lake across the street from the hospital. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. That's it. The lake. The EEG machine. Nurse Kalarjian. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Just then, an AMBULANCE SKIDS up to the nearest entrance. jump out and run towards the blast site. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't cheat destiny. I know what I have to do to save us. I have to die. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy. You can't give up now. We can still fight this thing. But Kimberly isn't listening. She stares through the glas the --

dialogues.speaker: AMBULANCE
dialogues.text: A red stripe down the side, but the hood is completely wh floral scented air-fresheners hang from the rearview. The her vision! And it's running! KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to do this. Kimberly wipes tears from her eyes, kisses Thomas' cheek, and runs before he can speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly heads right for the open ambulance. The driver's seems to swing open for her as she gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas frantically tries to get through the electric door SPARK and short out. He struggles to pry them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly shifts into gear and speeds off. Thomas squeezes doors and runs after her. An EMT, the driver of the stole rushes outside. EMT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas chases the ambulance, watching helplessly as it ba curbs, pylons and a fence, ultimately plunging straight i lake! Thomas sprints to the lake as fast as he can - the EMT tr behind.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE AMBULANCE
dialogues.text: Kimberly panics as the ambulance fills with water and she final gasp of air --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LAKE'S EDGE
dialogues.text: Thomas stares in horror at the percolating air bubbles as descends below the surface -- and he dives in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas swims into the dark, murky water. Deeper and deepe to the ambulance and tries to open the door. Stuck. He wi baton and BANGS on the glass - nothing! He tries coming up for air, but his pants snag on the jag the twisted bumper. He squirms frantically... And as his exhausted body loses consciousness, everything FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS.
dialogues.text: DR. KALARJIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready and...CLEAR! The SHOCK of defribulator paddles brings Kimberly back to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up at Dr. Kalarjian, all she can see is part of a face and a partial nametage reading "Kalarjian". It would appear as if she's choking Kimberly, but -- An EEG MONITOR turns from a flatline to a steady heartbea POV as the premonition. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five CC's of narcodon. I want her stabilized and prepped for ICU. Kimberly turns her head to see

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Unconscious, CPR being performed on him by the EMT (who's wet). Thomas doesn't respond. An INTERN opens an eyelid, points a flashlight at his eye his head, nothing. The sopping wet EMT goes back to perfo Finally, Thomas coughs up water, chokes, gasps for air, t UPRIGHT. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly?! He turns to see Kimberly reaching out for him. Immeasurab he takes her hand and allows himself to be eased back dow platform. Kimberly's eyes fill with tears. KIMBERLY (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back. We did it.           For real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   I can feel it too. Outside, a parting of dark clouds causes a shaft of sunli into the hospital. Its light covers Kimberly and Thomas w ethereal glow. There are no more doubts; they've won. They exchange meek, yet triumphant smiles in the smoky, c hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are at a summer barbecue. Frisbee, lawn darts, croquet Everyone's happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shish -Kabob entering a mouth.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: Kimberly taking a bite, relishing the taste and calmly pu metal skewer from her mouth. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, this is delicious. I can't believe I used to be a vegan. Thomas, out of uniform, takes a bite of his own. As the m is deep in his mouth -- A running FRISBEE PLAYER accidentally bumps into Thomas! Thomas gives the guy a friendly pat and goes back to rewr mouth around the shish-kabob. MR. BURROUGHS (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the deal, Thomas? Three months and you still haven't asked my daughter out on a date. Kimberly turns red as Mr. Burroughs appears and takes a s THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with a platonic relationship? MR. GIBBONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Platonic my ass. That's for ugly women. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, leave him alone, Dad. THOMAS (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, don't make me cite you for harassment. MR. GIBBONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please. I'm not hurting anyone. (looking around, lowering voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, if you can beat Death, what's he got to worry about me for? Mr. Gibbons sits down at the table with two plates of foo MRS. GIBBONS, joins. MR. GIBBONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you still never explained to us how you did it. It seems by now everyone's familiar with the concept. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, technically when we died, we gave Death what it wanted. And by the time we were revived, it had already moved on to graver pastures. Mrs. Gibbons makes a face, finding the discourse distaste changes the conversation. MRS. GIBBONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'm having the greatest day? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food's great too, Mrs. Gibbons. Big props to you and Brian. MRS. GIBBONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our...pleasure. So, ready for the back-to -school season? NYU, right? KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three short glorious weeks away. MRS. GIBBONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds wonderful. I wish I were going myself. MR. GIBBONS (to Mr. Burroughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may want to think twice about letting her live in the village, Bob. Our eldest daughter moved there and came back with piercings all over her face. (looks grave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among other places. A chorus of friendly laughter. BRIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad used to call her the pincushion. From Hellraiser. BRIAN enters frame, soaking up fresh laughter. He holds a of raw chicken fillets and some long, wooden matches. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, you had the spatula last, right? MR. GIBBONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, here. Mr. Gibbons hands it over and Brian saunters away from ca SLIGHTLY OUT OF FOCUS, toward the barbecue, his body fram Kimberly and Thomas' heads. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks like he's having fun. MR. GIBBONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure does. Owes it to that friend of yours, in a way. Mr. Gibbons immediately regrets having said that. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that? MR. GIBBONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Brian was nearly hit by an ambulance the day...but your friend Rory pulled him back at the last second. Kimberly and Thomas ominously turn their heads around. In Brian fidgets in front of the barbecue. MRS. GIBBONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never told me that, Peter. Boy, that was lucky. BOOM!!! The PROPANE TANK blows Brian to smithereens. A de silence follows, punctuated when Brian's ARM lands on Mrs plate. PLOP. FADE TO BLACK. END CREDITS.
